item.title: DNS Rebinding
item.description: These attacks involve using DNS rebinding to allow a website to send requests to HTTP servers on a user’s machine. The targets include RPC servers included with uTorrent and with Blizzard Updater. DNS rebinding is meant to get around the same origin policy. The scheme is: setup a domain and a DNS server with a short TTL. Once that’s expired, serve a script that makes a request to the origin domain - but when the browser makes a DNS request, respond with localhost instead.
